definition[0]: to choose someone for an official position by voting
example[0]: the country’s first democratically elected government
example[1]: a new method for electing the leader of the party
example[2]: In 1768, John Wilkes was elected as their Member of Parliament.
example[3]: He was elected to a US state governorship.
explanation[0]: Elect is often passive in this meaning
example[4]: the country’s first democratically elected president
example[5]: John Brown was elected to the board last year.
example[6]: Steven J. Shapiro was elected vice president, corporate planning.
definition[1]: a person who has been elected to a particular job but has not yet started doing it
example[7]: the Jacksonville Chamber of Commerce’s chairman elect
